Educational Stages

In order to memorize the Holy Quran, the department of the Holy Quran has been divided into four departments
[vc_empty_space height=”64px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/6″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” margin_top=”5″ margin_bottom=”10″ type=”vc_default” css=”.vc_custom_1609429571876{margin-bottom: 10px !important;background-image: url(https://besttechglobal.com/projects/marif/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/bg-vector-2-1.png?id=541) !important;background-position: 0 0 !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;}”][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12″ css=”.vc_custom_1609272514815{margin-left: 50px !important;background-image: url(https://besttechglobal.com/projects/marif/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/bg-vector-2-3.png?id=543) !important;background-position: 0 0 !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;}”]

Step 1: Department of Quran

[vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1609429000884{padding-top: 30px !important;}”]Department of Qaeda takes about 6 months for completion. It helps to develop the ability to recite the Quran fluently with Tajweed.

Course Duration: Approximately 6 months.

Courses: AL-Maarif Qaeda, Islamic studies, Complete Namaz.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12″ css=”.vc_custom_1609249557154{margin-right: 50px !important;}”][vc_single_image image=”16321″ img_size=”full” alignment=”right” style=”vc_box_outline” border_color=”green” css_animation=”slideInRight”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” margin_top=”5″ margin_bottom=”10″ type=”vc_default” css=”.vc_custom_1609429632592{margin-bottom: 10px !important;}”][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12″ css=”.vc_custom_1609249717469{margin-left: 50px !important;}”][vc_single_image image=”16322″ img_size=”full” style=”vc_box_outline” border_color=”green” css_animation=”slideInLeft”][/vc_column][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12″ css=”.vc_custom_1609249605582{margin-right: 50px !important;}”]

Step 2: Department Of Nazra

[vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1609429425182{padding-top: 30px !important;}”]It is important for (Hifz) Students to recite the Quran on daily basis otherwise it is difficult for them to memorize it. Therefore, after completion of Qaeda, girls are taught to recite with Tajweed. As a result of perfection and a grasp of (Hifz), they are able to recite the Quran according to the rules of Tajweed.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” margin_top=”5″ margin_bottom=”10″ type=”vc_default” css=”.vc_custom_1609429648122{margin-bottom: 10px !important;}”][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12″ css=”.vc_custom_1609249684626{margin-left: 50px !important;}”]

Step 3: Department of Memorization (Hifz)

[vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1609429471124{padding-top: 30px !important;}”]Memorization of Quran is a laborious and pre-requisite process. In this regards, everyone including students their parents and teachers plays a vital role. A glimpse of weakness from either side makes it difficult to achieve the desired results. Student’s daily files, monthly assessments, quarterly and annual reports are prepared and presented. The pace of lessons is more or less according to guardian’s wishes.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12″ css=”.vc_custom_1609249693563{margin-right: 50px !important;}”][vc_single_image image=”16323″ img_size=”full” alignment=”right” style=”vc_box_outline” border_color=”green” css_animation=”slideInRight”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” margin_top=”5″ margin_bottom=”10″ type=”vc_default” css=”.vc_custom_1609429661844{margin-bottom: 10px !important;background-position: 0 0 !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;}”][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12″ css=”.vc_custom_1609249798663{margin-left: 50px !important;}”][vc_single_image image=”16319″ img_size=”full” style=”vc_box_outline” border_color=”green” css_animation=”slideInLeft”][vc_empty_space height=”64px”][/vc_column][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12″ css=”.vc_custom_1609272917226{margin-right: 50px !important;background-image: url(https://besttechglobal.com/projects/marif/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/bg-vector-3-1.png?id=544) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: contain !important;}”]

Step 4: Department of Conjugation (Gardaan)

[vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1609429510258{padding-top: 30px !important;}”]After completion of memorizing the Quran it is necessary to read it repeatedly to modify recitation skills. This process is called ‘Conjugation (Gardaan)”. Students practice for Qirat and Tajweed of the Quran for a period of one year. Annual exams of these departments are held under the Federation of Arab Madrassas of Pakistan.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”64px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row_content” equal_height=”yes” rtl_reverse=”yes” bg_type=”image” parallax_style=”vcpb-vz-jquery” bg_image_new=”id^2284|url^https://besttechglobal.com/projects/marif/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/Masjid-Wallpaper-58-images-.jpg|caption^null|alt^null|title^Masjid-Wallpaper-58+-images-|description^null” bg_img_attach=”fixed” enable_overlay=”enable_overlay_value” overlay_color=”#000000″ overlay_pattern=”01.png” overlay_pattern_opacity=”90″ overlay_pattern_attachment=”fixed” css=”.vc_custom_1609430494418{padding-top: 6% !important;background-color: #000000 !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”64px”][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/6″][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”2/3″]

Highlighted Features

There are limited seats of 20 to 25 girls in a class, which maintains full attention of the teacher towards the students.

 

A diary is issued to track the performance of each student.

 

After completing conjugation (Gardaan), students can easily recites 5 volumes of the Holy Qur’an in one go.

 

Supervisors pay full attention to every student in the class and inform the administrators about the academic performance.

[/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/6″][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_empty_space height=”64px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row_content” gap=”20″ bg_type=”bg_color” ult_hide_row=”ult_hide_row_value” ult_hide_row_tablet=”tablet” ult_hide_row_tablet_small=”xs_tablet” ult_hide_row_mobile=”mobile” ult_hide_row_mobile_large=”xl_mobile” css=”.vc_custom_1609272991501{margin-top: 50px !important;margin-bottom: 50px !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_column][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” gap=”15″ css=”.vc_custom_1609248903073{margin-right: 50px !important;margin-left: 50px !important;}”][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″ css=”.vc_custom_1609248155789{border: 5px double #b1650d !important;border-radius: 5px !important;}”]

Examination System

  • Monthly Assessments
  • Quarterly Examinations
  • Half-Yearly Exams
  • Examination from Wifaq-ul-Madaris-al-Arabiah after conjugation (Gardaan).

[/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″ css=”.vc_custom_1609248604626{border: 5px double #b1650d !important;border-radius: 5px !important;}”]

Admission Plans

Maarif-ul-Quran age preference for admission of a girl is ‘6 years’, which proclaims her matriculation at the age of 15.

Required Admission Documents

  • Birth certificate certified by Nadra
  • Father’s / Guardian’s computerized CNIC

[/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” gap=”15″ css=”.vc_custom_1609248903073{margin-right: 50px !important;margin-left: 50px !important;}”][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″ css=”.vc_custom_1609248155789{border: 5px double #b1650d !important;border-radius: 5px !important;}”]

Educational Fee

Admission fee: Rs.3000.

Monthly fee: Rs.2700.

Note: Fees will increase by 10% every year.

[/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″ css=”.vc_custom_1609248604626{border: 5px double #b1650d !important;border-radius: 5px !important;}”]

Transportation

Transportation is not the responsibility of institute. Parents are responsible for arranging transportation themselves. However, the management of institution will definitely assist in such matters.
